title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0020

segments.en: Well, hello everyone and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name's Erica.
And I'm Marco.
So Marco, how are you doing today?
I'm doing great and I'm really looking forward to our lesson because we're going to the eye doctor today.
segments.cn: 我很好，我非常期待我们的课程，因为我们今天要去看眼科医生。

segments.en: Okay, so we've got an elementary lesson about going to the eye doctor.
segments.cn: 好的，我们有一节关于去看眼科医生的基础课程。

segments.en: Yes.
Well, let's get started then with our vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 那么，让我们开始我们的词汇预览吧。

segments.en: We have three words today in our vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 今天我们的词汇预览有三个单词。

segments.en: All three words come from our dialogue.
segments.cn: 这三个单词都来自我们的对话。

segments.en: Our first word is struggle.
Struggle.
Struggle.
Struggle.
So Marco, when I struggle to do something, what does that mean?
segments.cn: Marco，当我挣扎去做某事时，这是什么意思？

segments.en: It means it's difficult.
It means that you have a hard time so you can't really do it very quickly.
segments.cn: 这意味着你很难做到，所以你不能很快完成。

segments.en: So you have to try really hard.
You have to try really hard.
Yeah, to do something that's difficult.
segments.cn: 是的，做一些困难的事情。

segments.en: Yes.
Okay, our next word is blurry.
segments.cn: 好的，下一个单词是模糊。

segments.en: Blurry.
Blurry.
Blurry.
B-L-U-R-R-Y.
Blurry.
Whenever something is blurry, you can't really see it well.
segments.cn: 当某物模糊时，你看不清楚。

segments.en: It's not clear.
Right.
That's right.
Everything will be blurry.
Okay, and our final word is prescription.
segments.cn: 好的，最后一个单词是处方。

segments.en: Prescription.
Prescription.
Often when you go to the doctor and you need some medicine, he writes out a prescription.
segments.cn: 通常当你去看医生需要一些药物时，他会开处方。

segments.en: Right.
A little paper that says all the medicine that you need and then you can go to the drugstore and buy it.
segments.cn: 一张写着你需要的所有药物的小纸条，然后你可以去药店买。

segments.en: Exactly.
Okay, so those three words you'll hear in today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，这三个单词你将在今天的对话中听到。

segments.en: And I think it's time we listened to the dialogue.
Hello, Arthur.
What seems to be the problem?
Hey, Doc.
Well, I think I might need glasses.
I'm getting headaches and I really struggle to see things that are far away.
segments.cn: 我头痛，而且我真的很难看清远处的东西。

segments.en: But I've always had 20-20 vision.
Sounds like you might be farsighted.
Okay then, cover your left eye and read the chart in front of you.
segments.cn: 好吧，遮住你的左眼，读一下你面前的图表。

segments.en: And I can't quite make out the other symbol, but I think it's the peace sign.
segments.cn: 我看不太清楚另一个符号，但我想它是和平符号。

segments.en: Well, Arthur, you're as blind as a bat.
segments.cn: 好吧，Arthur，你的视力差得像只蝙蝠。

segments.en: Yeah, I know.
My vision is really blurry at times.
segments.cn: 我的视力有时真的很模糊。

segments.en: Okay then, head over to the other room and pick out some frames while I fill out your prescription.
segments.cn: 好吧，去另一个房间挑选一些框架，我会填写你的处方。

segments.en: Thanks, Doc.
Arthur, that's the bathroom.
Well, this guy really has poor vision, hey?
segments.cn: 哦，这家伙的视力真差，是吧？

segments.en: Well, actually, you know what?
I've walked into the bathroom, the men's bathroom, actually, instead of the women's bathroom.
segments.cn: 我走进了男洗手间，而不是女洗手间。

segments.en: And that's not because I wasn't wearing my glasses.
segments.cn: 这不是因为我没戴眼镜。

segments.en: That's because you weren't paying attention.
That's true.
Okay, let's take a look today at our language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们来看看我们的语言要点。

segments.en: The first word on our language takeaway for today is 20-20 vision.
segments.cn: 今天的语言要点第一个单词是20-20视力。

segments.en: If I have 20-20 vision... It means that you have perfect vision.
segments.cn: 如果我有20-20视力……这意味着你有完美的视力。

segments.en: Which I do not have.
No, me neither.
So I usually wear glasses as well.
But yeah, people that have 20-20 vision don't need glasses.
segments.cn: 但是，是的，拥有20-20视力的人不需要眼镜。

segments.en: They can see clearly and perfectly.
segments.cn: 他们可以清晰而完美地看见。

segments.en: Next word is farsighted.
Farsighted.
Farsighted.
Farsighted.
So if I'm farsighted, I can't see very well, right?
segments.cn: 所以如果我远视，我看得不太好，对吧？

segments.en: So if you're farsighted, you can see things that are near.
segments.cn: 所以如果你远视，你可以看清近处的东西。

segments.en: So you can see things that are far away, but things that are close are blurred.
segments.cn: 所以你可以看清远处的东西，但近处的东西是模糊的。

segments.en: And the opposite would be?
Near sighted.
You can see things that are close well, but not far.
segments.cn: 你可以看清近处的东西，但看不清远处的东西。

segments.en: Far sighted and near sighted.
Okay, so our next word is make out.
segments.cn: 好的，下一个单词是辨认。

segments.en: Make out.
Make out.
Make out.
That's kind of a funny little phrase.
Let's listen to a few examples of this phrase so we can understand how it's used.
segments.cn: 让我们听几个这个短语的例子，以便理解它的用法。

segments.en: I can't make out what this says.
segments.cn: 我看不清楚这上面写的是什么。

segments.en: The writing is too small.
If you look carefully, you can almost make out a few of the stars in the sky.
segments.cn: 如果你仔细看，你几乎可以辨认出天空中的几颗星星。

segments.en: Can you see what's written on the sign there?
segments.cn: 你能看到那里的标志上写了什么吗？

segments.en: No, I can't quite make it out.
Okay, so basically make out is to see clearly.
segments.cn: 好的，基本上辨认就是看得清楚。

segments.en: Exactly.
Make out.
To see.
Okay, and our last word for language takeaway today is blind as a bat.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们语言要点的最后一个单词是像蝙蝠一样盲。

segments.en: Blind as a bat.
Blind as a bat.
So this is a really funny sounding expression.
segments.cn: 这是一个听起来很有趣的表达。

segments.en: One of these weird English idioms.
segments.cn: 这是一个奇怪的英语习语。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a really common expression that just means that you can't see.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一个非常常见的表达，意思是你看不见。

segments.en: Exactly.
So it's not like you actually are blind, right?
segments.cn: 所以并不是说你真的失明，对吧？

segments.en: But you just really can't see very well.
Okay.
Alright, we saw four great words today in our language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天我们在语言学习中看到四个很棒的词。

segments.en: Now I think we can listen to our dialogue another time.
segments.cn: 现在我想我们可以再听一次对话。

segments.en: But this time it's going to be slower so we can pick up all these great words that we just talked about.
segments.cn: 但这次会慢一点，这样我们可以记住刚才提到的所有好词。

segments.en: Hello, Arthur.
What seems to be the problem?
Hey, Doc.
Well, I think I might need glasses.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想我可能需要眼镜。

segments.en: I'm getting headaches and I really struggle to see things that are far away.
segments.cn: 我头痛，远处的东西看得很吃力。

segments.en: But I've always had 20-20 vision.
Sounds like you may be farsighted.
Okay, then.
Cover your left eye and read the chart in front of you.
segments.cn: 盖住你的左眼，读一下你面前的图表。

segments.en: And I can't quite make out the other symbol, but I think it's a peace sign.
segments.cn: 我看不太清楚另一个符号，但我想它是和平符号。

segments.en: Wow.
Arthur, you're as blind as a bat.
segments.cn: 亚瑟，你真是像蝙蝠一样盲。

segments.en: Yeah, I know.
My vision is really blurry at times.
segments.cn: 我的视力有时真的很模糊。

segments.en: Okay, then.
Head on over to the other room and pick out some frames while I fill out your prescription.
segments.cn: 走到另一个房间，挑选一些框架，我会填写你的处方。

segments.en: Thanks, Doc.
Arthur, that's the bathroom.
Alright, great stuff on our dialogue.
And with this we can start now with putting it together.
segments.cn: 现在我们可以开始整合了。

segments.en: Putting it together.
So we saw a couple useful phrases in this dialogue and I think we can show you how to use these phrases in a few different ways.
segments.cn: 在这段对话中我们看到了一些有用的短语，我想我们可以展示如何以几种不同的方式使用这些短语。

segments.en: Right.
The first one that we have today is what seems to be.
segments.cn: 今天我们第一个短语是“似乎是什么”。

segments.en: So we heard in the dialogue, the doctor said...
What seems to be the problem.
We can use this same expression in a number of different ways.
segments.cn: 我们可以用这个表达的多种不同方式。

segments.en: Let's listen.
Example 1.
What seems to be the problem.
Example 2.
What seems to be the matter.
Example 3.
What seems to be the trouble.
Okay, so with these examples we can see how we can use the phrase what seems to be in many different ways.
segments.cn: 好吧，通过这些例子我们可以看到如何以多种方式使用“似乎是什么”这个短语。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a great way of asking what's the problem.
segments.cn: 是的，这是询问问题的好方法。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at another phrase.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看另一个短语。

segments.en: We heard in the dialogue, the doctor said...
segments.cn: 我们在对话中听到，医生说...

segments.en: Head on over to the other room.
Right.
And with this phrase, head on, we can combine it with other prepositions to indicate another place.
segments.cn: 用这个短语“走到”，我们可以与其他介词结合，表示另一个地方。

segments.en: Exactly.
Let's hear three examples.
Example 1.
Head on in.
Example 2.
Head on out.
Example 3.
Head on up.
Okay, so for example we can say, head on into the house, it's gonna rain soon.
segments.cn: 好吧，例如我们可以说，走进屋里，马上要下雨了。

segments.en: Or we can say, hey guys, let's head on out to the park.
segments.cn: 或者我们可以说，嘿，大家，走出去公园吧。

segments.en: Or I can also say, head on up to my room, I'll be there in a second.
segments.cn: 或者我也可以说，走上我的房间，我马上就到。

segments.en: Great.
Those are some cool phrases.
Right, and they're really useful.
So why don't we listen to our dialogue and maybe we'll hear them again.
segments.cn: 那我们为什么不再听一次对话，也许我们会再次听到它们。

segments.en: Hello Arthur, what seems to be the problem.
segments.cn: 你好亚瑟，似乎有什么问题。

segments.en: Well, I think I might need glasses.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想我可能需要眼镜。

segments.en: I'm getting headaches and I really struggle to see things that are far away.
segments.cn: 我头痛，远处的东西看得很吃力。

segments.en: But I've always had 20-20 vision.
Hmm, sounds like you might be far-sighted.
segments.cn: 嗯，听起来你可能是远视。

segments.en: Okay then, cover your left eye and read the chart in front of you.
segments.cn: 好吧，盖住你的左眼，读一下你面前的图表。

segments.en: Hmm... X, E, R, 3, uh, question Mark, and I can't quite make out the other symbol, but I think it's the peace sign.
segments.cn: 嗯... X, E, R, 3，呃，问号，我看不太清楚另一个符号，但我想它是和平符号。

segments.en: Wow, Arthur, you're as blind as a bat.
segments.cn: 哇，亚瑟，你真是像蝙蝠一样盲。

segments.en: Yeah, I know, my vision is really blurry at times.
segments.cn: 是的，我知道，我的视力有时真的很模糊。

segments.en: Okay then, head over to the other room and pick out some frames while I fill out your prescription.
segments.cn: 好吧，走到另一个房间，挑选一些框架，我会填写你的处方。

segments.en: Thanks doc.
Arthur, that's the bathroom.
Okay, so talking about going to the eye doctor today, I have a question for our listeners.
segments.cn: 好吧，谈到今天去眼科医生，我有个问题要问我们的听众。

segments.en: A challenge for our listeners.
segments.cn: 给我们的听众一个挑战。

segments.en: What's it called when you can't distinguish colors?
segments.cn: 当你无法区分颜色时，这叫什么？

segments.en: So like when you can't tell the difference between red and blue and green.
segments.cn: 就是当你无法分辨红色、蓝色和绿色时。

segments.en: Right, so what is that condition called?
segments.cn: 对，所以这种情况叫什么？

segments.en: There's like a technical term, we want the technical term.
segments.cn: 有一个专业术语，我们想要专业术语。

segments.en: We want the technical term.
So we'll be looking for it on our comments page and be sure to, if you know the answer, post it.
segments.cn: 所以我们会在评论页面寻找，如果你知道答案，请务必发布。

segments.en: At EnglishPod.com.
Also, if you have questions about today's lesson or any other lesson, please come and visit our website and ask us.
segments.cn: 此外，如果你对今天的课程或其他课程有任何问题，请来我们的网站询问。

segments.en: Yeah, we hope to see you there, but until then it's... Goodbye!
segments.cn: 是的，我们希望在那里见到你，但在此之前，祝你再见！
